column4: UPDATE 2-Peabody profit falls on lower prices  but beats expectations
column5: (Adds details on costs  comments on thermal coal market; updates market reaction)

column4: RPT-Peabody to cut 170 coal mining jobs across Australia
column5: SYDNEY  July 23 Peabody Energy Group  the world's largest private-sector coal miner  said it will cut 170 jobs across Australia or about 5.7 percent of its total workforce in the country as it looks to reduce costs amid a global glut in coal supply.

column4: Peabody to cut 170 coal mining jobs across Australia
column5: SYDNEY  July 23 Peabody Energy Group  the world's largest private-sector coal miner  said it will cut 170 jobs across Australia or about 5.7 percent of its total workforce in the country as it looks to reduce costs amid a global glut in coal supply.

column4: Polaris posts higher profit  raises full-year forecast again
column5: July 23 Polaris Industries Inc reported a higher second-quarter profit on Tuesday and raised its outlook for the full year  citing strong sales of its all-terrain vehicles and other power sports products in North America.

column4: Seoul shares gain 1 pct as large caps rally; POSCO climbs
column5: SEOUL  July 23 Seoul shares advanced firmly on Tuesday  rising for a second straight session on continued foreign investor demand and solid gains in the market's large cap issues including Samsung Electronics Co Ltd and POSCO.

column4: Fitch Assigns Final 'AAA' Rating to RBC's Series CB10 Registered Mortgage Covered Bond
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) NEW YORK  July 23 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has assigned a final 'AAA' rating with  Stable Outlook to Royal Bank of Canada's (RBC; 'AA'/'F1+'  Stable Outlook)  series CB10 USD-1.75 billion three-year soft bullet mortgage covered bonds.  Series CB10 is RBC's first registered covered bond issuance following the  registration of its program earlier this month with the Canada Mortgage and  Housing Corporation (CMHC). The issuance re-opened the

column4: Southern Copper Q2 net down 34 pct on spending  lower copper prices
column5: LIMA  July 23 Southern Copper's net earnings dropped 33.9 percent to $372.7 million in the second quarter compared to the same period a year ago  as spending rose and copper prices fell  the company said late on Monday.

column4: U.S. probes Southwest Air's LaGuardia landing
column5: NEW YORK U.S. safety regulators launched an investigation on Tuesday into the collapse of the front landing gear on a Southwest Airlines plane shortly after it touched down at New York's LaGuardia Airport on Monday evening.

column4: NY LaGuardia Airport runway reopens after rough Southwest landing
column5: NEW YORK A runway at New York City's LaGuardia Airport  shut after a landing gear on a Southwest Airlines jet collapsed on touchdown Monday evening  was reopened Tuesday morning  an airport spokesman said. | Video

column4: Green light seen for Telecom Italia network spin-off
column5: ROME/MILAN Italy's telecoms regulator is likely to tell Telecom Italia  on Thursday it can go ahead with a spin-off of its fixed-line network  two sources with knowledge of the process said  easing concerns the project could be scrapped.

column4: Deals of the day -- mergers and acquisitions
column5: (Adds Vodafone  DuPont  Sourcefire  Philips 66  Telecom Italia; Updates Telefonica  Maroc Telecom)

column4: Antitrust says CDP investment in Italy Telecom network needs analysis
column5: ROME  July 23 The president of Italy's Antitrust regulator said on Tuesday that the possible purchase by state-backed fund Cassa Depositi e Prestiti (CDP) of Telecom Italia's fixed-line network would have to be reviewed for its effect on competition.

column4: RPT-Fitch Affirms Telefonica  Telefonica Germany on E-Plus Acquisition
column5: July 23 (The following statement was released by the rating agency)

column4: Telefonica says still on track for debt target with E-Plus deal
column5: MADRID  July 23 Spanish telecoms firm Telefonica  said on Tuesday its debt target of under 47 billion euros ($62 billion) by year-end would be unaffected by its purchase of Dutch group KPN's German business E-Plus.

column4: Teva developing new medicines to treat brain disorders -CEO
column5: JERUSALEM  July 23 Teva Pharmaceutical Industries expects to complete development of new medicines in the next few years aimed at treating brain disorders as the global population ages  its chief executive said.

column4: S&P 500 dips and Dow gains on UTX; Apple up late
column5: NEW YORK The S&P 500 snapped a four-day winning streak on Tuesday and pulled back from Monday's record closing high  while healthy earnings from United Technologies gave the Dow a slight lift. | Video

column4: Travelers to cut auto insurance rates to battle competition
column5: Travelers Cos Inc  said it would cut jobs and reduce prices of auto insurance  steps investors took as an indication that rates had risen too far and competition was increasing.

column4: UPDATE 3-Travelers to cut auto insurance rates to battle competition
column5: * Second-quarter operating earnings per share $2.13 vs est $1.60

column4: US STOCKS-Wall St to open slightly higher on earnings from Dow stocks
column5: * Dow components Travelers  DuPont shares up following results

column4: Travelers profit handily beats estimates as disaster losses fall
column5: U.S. insurer Travelers Cos Inc  posted an 85 percent rise in quarterly profit owing to lower disaster losses  blowing past Wall Street estimates.

column4: Exclusive: Ford to build current and new F-150 pickups at same time
column5: DETROIT Ford Motor Co will produce both its current F-150 pickup and a new model for about six months to avoid disrupting sales of the top-selling U.S. vehicle and safeguard against potential kinks tied to the truck's extensive overhaul  people familiar with the plans said.

column4: UPDATE 1-Ford to develop hybrid trucks solo after Toyota tie-up ends
column5: DETROIT  July 23 Ford Motor Co and Toyota Motor Corp ended their partnership to develop hybrid pickup trucks and sport-utility vehicles after studying the feasibility of such a project for nearly two years  Ford said on Tuesday.

column4: Toyota opens its inner circle to outsiders for overseas push
column5: NAGOYA  Japan Mark Hogan  a former General Motors Co  executive  says he often chided Toyota Motor Corp  for its weakness in fast-growing Brazil and Argentina despite having reached the No. 1 spot in the global industry.

column4: Toyota opens its inner circle to outsiders for overseas push
column5: NAGOYA  Japan  July 23 Mark Hogan  a former General Motors Co executive  says he often chided Toyota Motor Corp for its weakness in fast-growing Brazil and Argentina despite having reached the No. 1 spot in the global industry.

column4: Cukurova says Altimo thwarting efforts to recover Turkcell stake
column5: LONDON  July 23 Turkey's Cukurova on Tuesday accused Russian investment firm Altimo of mounting a cynical legal campaign in New York to try to stop it from recovering a controlling stake in mobile phone operator Turkcell  under the terms set by Britain's Privy Council court.

column4: UPS profit falls as global customers use cheaper shipping
column5: United Parcel Service Inc  on Tuesday posted a smaller quarterly profit as customers  especially on international routes  chose slower  cheaper shipping services. | Video

column4: UPS posts lower second-quarter profit
column5: July 23 United Parcel Service Inc on Tuesday posted a smaller quarterly profit as customers  especially on international routes  chose slower  cheaper shipping services.

column4: RPT-UPDATE 2-US opens probe into steel pipe imports from 9 countries
column5: WASHINGTON  July 23 The U.S. Commerce Department on Tuesday launched one of its biggest trade investigations in years into charges that manufacturers in South Korea  India and seven other countries are selling steel pipe used by oil and natural gas producers at unfairly low prices in the United States.

column4: Lockheed hopes for next Pentagon deal on F-35 jets soon
column5: WASHINGTON Lockheed Martin Co is making "good progress" in negotiations with the Pentagon about the next two batches of F-35 fighter jets and hopes to reach agreement soon  Chief Executive Marillyn Hewson said on Tuesday.

column4: Bullish on aerospace  United Tech lifts 2013 forecast
column5: United Technologies Corp  the world's largest maker of elevators and air conditioners  raised the bottom end of its 2013 earnings forecast on Tuesday  citing its growing confidence after a jump in aerospace orders and cost cuts.

column4: UPDATE 3-Bullish on aerospace  United Tech lifts 2013 forecast

column4: United Tech income rises after Goodrich buyout
column5: July 23 United Technologies Corp  the world's largest maker of elevators and air conditioners  reported higher second-quarter net income  helped mostly by its 2012 buyout of aircraft parts manufacturer Goodrich.

column4: Refiner Valero sees profit recovery if discounts widen
column5: Valero Energy Corp  on Tuesday reported a 44 percent drop in second-quarter profit on higher domestic oil prices  but its executives expect profits to improve through the rest of the year as U.S. crudes fall relative to other global grades.

column4: UPDATE 3-Refiner Valero sees profit recovery if discounts widen
column5: * Valero expects narrowed U.S. crude discounts to widen again

column4: Refiner Valero's profit tumbles as crude costs rise
column5: Refining company Valero Energy Corp  on Tuesday reported a 44 percent drop in second-quarter profit as higher prices for some of the crude oil it processes hurt margins.

column4: REFILE-Refiner Valero's profit falls as crude costs rise
column5: July 23 U.S. refining company Valero Energy Corp  said its  second-quarter profit fell 44 percent due to higher prices of some of the crude oil it processes.

column5: * Credit card firms can continue to set rules for merchants

column4: RPT-Diageo buys remainder of Chinese distiller
column5: LONDON  July 23 Global drinks firm Diageo  on Tuesday said it had received approval from Chinese authorities to become the sole shareholder in Sichuan Chengdu Shuijingfang Group Company (SJF Holdco)  the owner of white spirits company ShuiJingFang.

column4: Canada crude - Heavy dips on expectations of more supply
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  July 23 Canadian heavy crude prices weakened in thin trade on Tuesday  pushed lower by anticipation of increased supply from Imperial Oil's  Kearl oil sands project.
